items.text: length outside off, punched towards cover-point
items.shortText: Paul to Liton Das, no run

items.text: fuller on the stumps, Liton just presents the full face of the bat to caress it between the stumps and the non-striker for four
items.shortText: Paul to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: a touch fuller again, a bit outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
items.shortText: Paul to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length outside off, punched towards cover-point once more
items.shortText: Paul to Liton Das, no run

items.preText: James: "Derek, I think the reason those are at the top is that the "support acts" can play a bigger role these days."
items.text: short and wide, goes for the cut, straight to backward point
items.shortText: Chase to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length outside off, stays inside the line and lets it go
items.shortText: Chase to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: shuffles in his crease, Chase bowls it fuller on the stumps, clipped towards square leg
items.shortText: Chase to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: fuller outside off, pushes it towards the right of mid-on and sets off for a quick single
items.shortText: Chase to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: down the track but Chase pulls it back, well played in the end after being deceived, thrusts his bat and pad forward
items.shortText: Chase to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Nishikant Tripa: "It may also mean that Sachin did not have the kind of support from the tail enders that other players enjoyed. Can't think of any other reason?"
items.text: fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover
items.postText: Saurabh will take you through for the next ten overs
items.shortText: Chase to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Thanks Hemant. Bangladesh cruising so far
items.text: swiped across the line and taken at mid-on. Poor shot from Liton. It was back of a length outside off, he tried to pull it. Got a thick top edge that looped up for a fairly simple take.
items.shortText: Paul to Liton Das, OUT

dismissal.text: Liton Das c Powell b Paul 23 (33b 5x4 0x6) SR: 69.69

items.preText: Soumya Sarkar comes in at No.3
items.text: full ball, angled in from round the wicket, he defends it solidly from the crease
items.shortText: Paul to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Muhid: "I following the match from Badarpur, Assam, India (the former part of undivided Sylhet). Wish the border was dissolved, I could have witness the live action there. One more wish, at least the comment can get published." - At Cricinfo, we are a nation without borders
items.text: very full on off again, he walks across and works it away for a couple to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Paul to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs

items.text: loud appeal, not given They've gone for a review. Angled into the batsman again, strikes him flush on the pad in front of middle - but was the angle taking it too far down? Soumya had gone too far across and was trying to work it to midwicket again, but played all around it. Fortunately for him, ball tracking shows it to be clipping and it's umpire's call, so the original decision stays and Soumya survives. Bad shot though.
items.shortText: Paul to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: opens the face to run it down to third man
items.shortText: Paul to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: angling in from wide of the stumps around the wicket again. Tamim defends from the crease towards point
items.shortText: Paul to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Mazhar: "And Liton gives it away again. He plays some gorgeous shots and then plays an awful shot to get out. His career has been this replay of the same. He averages only 21 with so much talent."
items.text: full ball angled into him, he steers it to point
items.shortText: Chase to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: flatter and still full, he comes on the front foot to defend
items.shortText: Chase to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: flattish and full again, but moves the line outside off. He defends again
items.shortText: Chase to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: brings it straighter that time, and he tries to drive, but it goes to mid-off from the inside edge
items.shortText: Chase to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: too full, ends up as a low full toss which is clipped to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Chase to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: given some air and Tamim was playing back to it. It dips and turns near his feet, but he manages to defend it
items.shortText: Chase to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Bishnu: "Nice improvement in bowling discipline from windies. No extra in first 10 overs." - Yes, especially after the last ODI
items.text: length ball outside off, he comes forward and nudges it to point's left
items.shortText: Paul to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: back of a length but angling in so there's no room to cut. He drives from close to his body, opening the face to play it to point
items.shortText: Paul to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: given room outside off that time and too full, Tamim unfurls a flowing cover drive. There is a sweeper on the boundary so it won't go all the way
items.shortText: Paul to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run
